Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2019 12:24AM hiljflan wrote: I have three daughters and this was the main reason my consultant ordered the test. I'm also considered quite young I suppose at 47. It came back negative which was expected but still a relief with my girls.
Posts.Title: Genetic testing for MBC Rosie24 Moderators

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2019 05:38AM - edited Feb 7, 2019 05:40AM by hiljflan Reading these posts give me hope! Diagnosed denovo in April last year with bone and liver mets, luminal a. Ac and taxol seemed to clear my liver met (it was 1cm) and showed no sign of activity in December's pet scan. Just finished targeted radiation on 3 spine mets and chest after November's mastectomy. Started tamoxifen in November and hoping it will keep me stable for a while. Has anyone had long term success with chemo and liver mets? As in I'm hoping it might stay gone!! Hope you're all having a lovely day ladies.
Posts.Title: Anyone 5+ years with liver mets and ER+ Her2-? ShetlandPony PaulaAmy
